intro: Metteniusa tessmanniana var. fragrantissima, commonly known as the fragrant metteniusa, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that emit a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and unique aromatic properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
